shortdesc.ph: Joins a channel with the connection ID.

p.codeblock: public abstract int joinChannelEx(String token, RtcConnection connection, ChannelMediaOptions options, IRtcEngineEventHandler eventHandler);

- (int)joinChannelExByToken:(NSString* _Nullable)token connection:(AgoraRtcConnection * _Nonnull)connection delegate:(id<AgoraRtcEngineDelegate> _Nullable)delegate mediaOptions:(AgoraRtcChannelMediaOptions* _Nonnull)mediaOptions joinSuccess:(void(^ _Nullable)(NSString* _Nonnull channel, NSUInteger uid, NSInteger elapsed))joinSuccessBlock;
public abstract int JoinChannelEx(string token, RtcConnection connection, ChannelMediaOptions options);
Future<void> joinChannelEx( {required String token, required RtcConnection connection, required ChannelMediaOptions options});

section.p: You can call this method multiple times to join more than one channel.

ul.li: If you are already in a channel, you cannot rejoin it with the same user ID.
If you want to join the same channel from different devices, ensure that the user IDs are different for all devices.
Ensure that the app ID you use to generate the token is the same as the app ID used when creating the instance.
In a multi-camera capture scenario, you need to call the method after calling this method to set the sourceType to , to ensure that the second camera captures normally.

plentry.pd: The callback class of . For details, see .
